      public void insertStartingCard(Player player)
      Parameters:

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn(int userHash, int points)
      Parameters:
      userHash - player userHash
      points - player points this method provides logic to end a player's turn by selecting next "onTurnPlayer", checking if given player has reached 20 points, then checks if game has to end by checking if it equals to "finalTurnPlayer"

    • drawResourceFromDeck

      public void drawResourceFromDeck(Player player)
      this method id used to pick a golden card from golden deck, provides simple logic to avoid NoSuchElementException inside deck drawing: once deck is empty, a little notification is sent to the client, so that its simple logic prevents client from requesting golden deck picking again.

    • drawGoldenFromDeck

      public void drawGoldenFromDeck(Player player)
      this method id used to pick a golden card from golden deck, provides simple logic to avoid NoSuchElementException inside deck drawing: once deck is empty, a little notification is sent to the client, so that his simple logic prevents client from requesting golden deck picking again.

    • drawResourceFromTable

      public void drawResourceFromTable(Player player, int index)
      this method is used to pick a card from table, there are always two cards, except when resource deck is empty : in this case, client controller is notified, so that client can't even request to pick from resource deck. If both decks are empty, match status changes to last turn.
      Parameters:
      player - player who requested to pick a resource card from table
      index - invalid input: '<'1 or 2>

    • drawGoldenFromTable

      public void drawGoldenFromTable(Player player, int index)
      this method is used to pick a card from table, there are always two cards, except when golden deck is empty. If both decks are empty, match status changes to last turn.
      Parameters:
      player - who requested to pick a resource card from table
      index - invalid input: '<'1 or 2>

    • insertCard

      public void insertCard(Player player, PlaceableCard card, int row, int column)
      This method is called to insert a card, A boolean is returned to verify if the card is placeable --> At the beginning the algorithm checks if the card is flipped, with a consequent update of the state of the card. the card is placed inside the matrix if the activation cost is matched, then the method checkInsertion is called to verify if the card is placeable inside the matrix in the requested position

    • checkValidMatrixCardId

      public boolean checkValidMatrixCardId(int targetId, Player player)
      Parameters:
      targetId - the id of the card to check
      player - requesting to place the card
      Returns:
      true is the card is inside the matrix

    • checkInsertion

      public void checkInsertion(Player player, PlaceableCard card, int row, int column)
      Parameters:
      player - calls the method
      card - to add
      row - row
      column - column The method that starts the Insertion rules sends new PlaceCardResponse with status true if the card passes the tests, at the end he is correctly positioned inside the matrix else sends new PlaceCardResponse with status false

    • verificationSetting

      public boolean verificationSetting(Player player, int row, int column, ArrayList<Node> visitedNodes)
      Parameters:
      row - used to find a card based on its top-left corner
      column - used to find the corner
      Returns:
      true, if the card passed all the requirements, it's important to remember that the card is already inserted!

    • checkActivationCost

      public boolean checkActivationCost(Player player, PlaceableCard card)
      Parameters:
      player - adding the card to the matrix
      card - to add
      Returns:
      false, if the player didn't have enough resources to place the card, true otherwise

    • checkNotAvailability

      public boolean checkNotAvailability(Player player, int row, int column)
      Parameters:
      player - adding the card to the matrix
      row - of the top-left corner of the card
      column - of the top-left corner of the card
      Returns:
      true if the corner is available, else false

    • deleteCoveredResource

      public void deleteCoveredResource(Player player, int row, int column)
      Parameters:
      player - adding the card to the
      row - of the top-left corner of the card
      column - of the top-left corner of the card This method remove the resources (corners) covered by the new card.

    • addCardPointsOnPlayer

      public void addCardPointsOnPlayer(Player player, PlaceableCard card, ArrayList<Node> visitedNodes)
      Parameters:
      card - it's the card to add
      visitedNodes - are the nodes that have been visited in the current iteration. This method adds the card's points in the counter of the player. It controls all the different cases.

    • startTurns

      public void startTurns()

    • checkCounterQuestPoints

      public void checkCounterQuestPoints(Player player)
      Parameters:
      player - who has the turn This method is called at the end of the game!

    • checkPatternQuest

      public void checkPatternQuest(Player player, int row, int column)
      Parameters:
      row - and the column is the top left corner of the card, This method is called each turn to avoid implementing an algorithm of research inside the matrix. If there's a pattern, it will be return true; the corners of the cards that will be useful for the patterns are marked as visited. After the verification of the pattern are added the points.
